title: Netflix’s CEO Talks Competitors and Live Sports Strategy
summary:
- Netflix's co-CEO Ted Sarandos discussed competitors like Apple TV Plus and HBO in a recent interview.
- Sarandos expressed confusion over Apple TV's strategy, calling it mainly a marketing play.
- He questioned HBO's rebranding to 'Max' and suggested it would reduce to just HBO in the long run.
- Sarandos indicated that he doesn’t see Amazon's original content as direct competition but admires their live sports strategy.
- Netflix is pushing into live events, focusing on unique, high-profile matches rather than complete seasons, aiming for events like the Super Bowl.

sources.title: Netflix’s CEO Talks Competitors and Live Sports Strategy

title: Tesla recalls Cybertrucks for exterior panels that fall off
summary:
- Tesla recalls approximately 46,000 Cybertrucks due to a potential issue with exterior steel trim panels that can peel off while driving.
- The recall is a response to warranty claims and a safety hazard identified by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).
- Tesla plans to use a different structural adhesive and a nut to secure the panels during the recall repair, which will be performed at no cost to owners.
- This is the eighth recall for the Cybertruck, following several past issues related to adhesive failures and other components coming loose.
- The recall was agreed upon on March 11, after further investigation into customer complaints sparked by NHTSA.

sources.title: Tesla recalls Cybertrucks for exterior panels that fall off

title: Solar notches another win as Microsoft adds 475 MW to power its AI data centers
summary:
- Microsoft adds 475 MW to its renewable power portfolio for data centers.
- Agreement made with AES for three solar projects in Illinois, Michigan, and Missouri.
- Microsoft has a growing renewable portfolio with over 34 GW of capacity, emphasizing the need for quick power sources due to rising computing demands.
- Recent trends show an increasing interest in nuclear power but renewables like solar remain more cost-effective and faster to deploy.
- Hybrid power plants combining solar and battery storage are emerging as competitive options against traditional power generation.

sources.title: Solar notches another win as Microsoft adds 475 MW to power its AI data centers

title: Australian government agencies could be customers of Israeli spyware, research suggests
summary:
- Australian agencies may be customers of Israeli spyware from Paragon Solutions according to a new report.
- In January, Meta reported over 90 individuals had their WhatsApp accounts compromised, raising concerns about potential Australian targets.
- The Citizen Lab identified two IP addresses in Australia linked to Paragon's Graphite spyware, suggesting possible use by government agencies.
- Paragon’s software provides full access to messaging apps and is exclusively sold to governments, not private enterprises.
- Australian government departments, including Home Affairs and the Signals Directorate, reportedly have no connections to Paragon Solutions.
- Paragon's executive chairman emphasized compliance with laws and regulations in their operations.

sources.title: Australian government agencies could be customers of Israeli spyware, research suggests

title: Spotify debuts ‘Concerts Near You’ playlists for discovering nearby shows
summary:
- Spotify launched a new playlist called “Concerts Near You” to help users discover upcoming local concerts.
- The playlist is updated weekly with 30 songs from artists performing nearby, along with event details and ticket links.
- Users can tailor their playlist based on their listening habits and should share their location to receive updates.

sources.title: Spotify debuts ‘Concerts Near You’ playlists for discovering nearby shows

title: Tesla Recalls Over 46,000 Cybertrucks Amid Safety Concerns and Calls for Oversight
summary:
- Families of Tesla crash victims are urging the US Department of Transportation to maintain a reporting rule for crashes involving autonomous vehicles.
- They express concerns about Elon Musk's influence potentially weakening oversight of Tesla's technologies.
- The letter to Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy cites fears that the Biden-era rule may be discarded, benefiting Tesla's reporting advantages.
- Since the rule's implementation, Tesla has reported over 1,800 crashes, accounting for most fatal crashes reported to NHTSA.
- The families highlight the importance of continued oversight to ensure safety for drivers using Tesla's Autopilot and Full Self-Driving features.
- Tesla has issued a recall for 46,096 Cybertrucks in the US due to a defect causing steel trim to come loose.
- The recall affects all Cybertrucks manufactured between November 13th, 2023, and February 27th, 2025.
- Approximately 1% of the impacted vehicles have been identified as having the trim defect.
- This is the eighth recall for the Cybertruck since its launch in December 2023.
- The issue has been reported by several owners and documented in forums and YouTube teardown videos.
- Tesla will replace the cant rail for free using new adhesive and clamping the panel to ensure safety.

sources.title: Families of Tesla Crash Victims Urge Oversight on Autopilot Investigations
Tesla recalls more than 46,000 Cybertrucks after trim starts falling off

title: Adapty releases a web-based solution for app makers to earn money outside app stores
summary:
- Adapty launches FunnelFox to help app makers acquire customers via web experiences and quizzes.
- FunnelFox allows app makers to bypass App Store fees by directing customers to download their app after payment.
- Adapty tracked $20 million in revenue during testing with 100 customers, reportedly doubling their revenue from mobile in-app purchases.
- The company offers features like drag-and-drop tools and AI suggestions for building customer acquisition funnels.
- Adapty operates on a revenue-sharing model with tiered pricing for FunnelFox not yet specified.
- The startup is profitable and has raised $2.5 million in capital, tracking $1.2 billion in revenue across 10,000 applications.

sources.title: Adapty releases a web-based solution for app makers to earn money outside app stores

title: The beautiful, retro tech of two theatrical sound designers
summary:
- Creative couple [Jessie Char](https://jessiechar.com/) and [Maxwell Neely-Cohen](https://maxy.world/) blend various art forms in their Brooklyn loft.
- They use vintage tech for sound design in theater, highlighted by their work on original sound cues for plays.
- Their first sound design project emerged from the writers' strike in 2023, leading them to create a fully scored play with sophisticated sound setups.
- Both prioritize manual creativity over smart tech, opting for personal connections and vintage equipment.

sources.title: The beautiful, retro tech of two theatrical sound designers

title: Tesla Faces 46,000 Cybertruck Recall Amid Growing Protests and Stock Decline
summary:
- Tesla announces a recall of 46,000 Cybertrucks to fix an exterior panel issue.
- Protests are planned globally on 29 March, with 500 demonstrations against Tesla.
- Tesla shares have lost one-third of their value over recent investor concerns, including Musk's involvement with Trump.
- Dan Ives from Wedbush warns Musk needs to balance his roles at Tesla and Doge to prevent brand damage.
- The recall relates to a cant rail, which can detach and pose a road hazard; replacements will be provided free of charge.
- Protests against Tesla branded as #TeslaTakedown, sparked by dissatisfaction with Elon Musk's actions.
- Tesla showrooms and charging stations are witnessing growing protests, with increasing police presence.
- Tesla's stock is declining, new car registrations are down, and owning a Tesla has become politically charged.
- Public criticism of Tesla products is rising, with popular YouTubers highlighting shortcomings in vehicles and self-driving technology.
- Ed Niedermeyer, an organizer of the protests, discusses the disparity between Tesla's mythos and reality, framing it as a pivotal moment for the company.

sources.title: Tesla backer says Musk must reduce Trump work, as 46,000 Cybertrucks recalled
How the Tesla brand turned so toxic

title: Meta AI Launches in Europe with Limitations
summary:
- Meta AI is launching in Europe after a delay of almost one year.
- The rollout includes 41 European countries and 21 overseas territories, limited to text-based chat features.
- Previous launch attempts were paused due to privacy concerns raised by Ireland's regulations.
- Users can brainstorm, plan trips, and answer questions using the web, but cannot generate or edit images.
- The assistant has not been trained on EU user data.
- Meta is committed to collaborate with regulators for future expansions of AI capabilities in Europe.
- Meta AI is launching in the EU with limited features compared to the U.S. version.
- Features include a chatbot function available in six languages, but creative functions like image generation are not included.
- The rollout extends to 27 EU countries and an additional 14 European nations, plus 21 overseas territories.
- Meta has faced regulatory challenges regarding data usage for training AI due to GDPR privacy regulations.
- The EU version of Meta AI was not trained on local user data, and therefore will not seek user consent.

sources.title: Meta AI is Rolling Out in Europe After Delay
Meta AI is finally coming to the EU, but with limitations

title: We’ve entered a forever war with bird flu
summary:
- Avian influenza H5N1 evolving rapidly, adapting to mammals.
- Human cases in the US rising, especially among farmworkers; risk of human-to-human transmission increasing.
- Over 70 confirmed human cases in the US, with recent hospitalizations and one death.
- Virus infected nearly 1,000 dairy herds since its detection in cows in 2024.
- A new D1.1 genotype of the virus spreading; potential for more severe human cases.
- Bird flu detected in domestic animals and wildlife, including cats and rodents.
- Experts suggest H5N1 is likely endemic, making eradication impossible.
- Calls for increased surveillance on farms and monitoring of potential animal reservoirs.
- Vaccination and biosecurity measures remain crucial for managing the outbreak.

sources.title: We’ve entered a forever war with bird flu

title: The Digimon franchise is getting a mobile card game of its own
summary:
- Bandai Namco announced the development of a new mobile card game, Digimon Alysion, during Digimon Con.
- The game will be free-to-play for iOS and Android, featuring card battles and a story mode.
- Players will also be able to raise virtual pets similar to Tamagotchi.
- A teaser trailer introduced the protagonist Kanata Hondo and her Digimon partner Gemmon.
- A closed beta for Digimon Alysion is expected to launch in the coming months, but no release date has been provided.

sources.title: The Digimon franchise is getting a mobile card game of its own

title: UK watchdog bans ‘shocking’ ads in mobile games that objectified women
summary:
- The UK Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) banned eight ads from mobile games for depicting women in a sexualized and objectifying manner.
- Investigations utilized avatars to monitor ad compliance, revealing significant breaches of UK advertising codes.
- The banned ads portrayed harmful scenarios including non-consensual sexual situations and violent control themes.
- The ASA received a survey showing 45% of UK consumers concerned about idealized body images and 44% about the objectification of women in ads.
- The move reflects ongoing efforts by the ASA to enforce stricter rules established in 2019 regarding representation in advertising.

sources.title: UK watchdog bans ‘shocking’ ads in mobile games that objectified women

title: Assassin's Creed Shadows: A Visual Masterpiece and Financial Strategy for Ubisoft
summary:
- Ubisoft is launching ‘Assassin’s Creed Shadows’ to revive its financial health amid declining sales.
- The game is set in 16th-century Japan, featuring historical figures such as Oda Nobunaga.
- Players can choose between two protagonists: Yasuke, a slave turned samurai, and Naoe, a peasant shinobi.
- The visuals are acclaimed as the most beautiful in video game history.
- The game offers multilingual voice options in English, Japanese, and Portuguese.
- It adopts a serious tone regarding historical authenticity, differing from previous entries in the series.
- The Discovery Tour mode is absent, pending requests for its return.

sources.title: Ubisoft’s ‘Assassin’s Creed Shadows’ seeks to revive finances

title: YouTube is investigating a bug causing low-res videos
summary:
- YouTube is experiencing a bug causing videos and shorts to stream at 144p or 360p for some users.
- This issue is reported on iOS, desktop, and smart TVs, regardless of internet connection strength.
- Users have reported that attempts to manually change video quality lead to it reverting back to low resolution.
- YouTube is aware of the problem and is actively investigating it, promising updates on their support thread.

sources.title: YouTube is investigating a bug causing low-res videos

title: Discord is bringing mobile ads to its platform
summary:
* Discord will launch a mobile pilot for Video Quests in June 2025.
* Users can earn rewards by watching ads, which will appear as a Quest bar at the bottom of the screen.
* Discord had previously been ad-free and relied on subscriptions for revenue.
* This rollout follows earlier tests and comes amid rumors of an upcoming IPO.

sources.title: Discord is bringing mobile ads to its platform

title: Space science is under threat from the anti-DEI purge
summary:
- President Trump's executive orders demanding an end to diversity programs have disrupted the space science community.
- NASA has suspended funding and banned activities related to diversity and outreach initiatives, affecting many employees.
- The threat of significant layoffs and budget cuts looms over NASA, raising fears among employees about job security and future funding.
- Many NASA workers are removing LGBTQIA symbols and pronouns from email signatures due to fears of repercussions.
- Experts warn that the rollback of diversity initiatives could hinder scientific discovery and create a less creative workforce.
- Individuals in the field of space science report feeling confused and fearful due to conflicting information regarding government policies.
- The push against diversity contradicts previous bipartisan support for NASA's diversity programs and scientific evidence that diverse groups yield better outcomes in research.

sources.title: Space science is under threat from the anti-DEI purge

title: Labour Reconsiders Smartphone Ban in Schools as Pressure Grows Over Effect on Teenagers
summary:
- Education Secretary Bridget Phillipson will reevaluate smartphone bans in schools due to concerns from MPs about social media effects on teens.
- A monitoring initiative will be launched to assess compliance and effectiveness of existing guidance on smartphone usage in schools.
- Current guidelines prohibit mobile phone use throughout the school day but lack enforcement measures.
- A focus on behavior and impact of policies will inform future National Behaviour Surveys.
- Public sentiment is leaning towards a complete smartphone ban, with a notable portion of parents expressing dissatisfaction with the current policy.

sources.title: Labour Reconsiders Smartphone Ban in Schools as Pressure Grows Over Effect on Teenagers

title: Huawei’s new flip phone is weirdly wide
summary:
- Huawei has launched the Pura X, a new flip phone with a 16:10 aspect ratio, opening sideways rather than vertically.
- This is Huawei's first phone to run HarmonyOS Next, which is not compatible with Android apps.
- The Pura X features a triple camera setup, a 6.3-inch display, and is priced at 7,499 yuan (around $1,037) in China.

sources.title: Huawei’s new flip phone is weirdly wide

title: Nvidia Invests Billions in US Manufacturing; TSMC's Arizona Project Lauded
summary:
- Taiwan’s President William Lai praised TSMC’s $100 billion investment in Arizona as a model for building non-Chinese chip supply chains.
- TSMC plans to build three chip foundries, an R&D center, and two packaging facilities, adding to a previous $65 billion commitment.
- The investment is driven by customer demand, not U.S. administration pressure; TSMC assures that U.S. plans won’t affect production in Taiwan.
- The project is set to create 40,000 construction jobs and additional tech and manufacturing jobs over four years.
- Arizona's Governor Katie Hobbs highlighted the benefits for advanced manufacturing and global technology advancements.
- Nvidia plans to invest several hundred billion dollars in US semiconductor and electronics manufacturing over the next four years.
- CEO Jensen Huang cites unpredictable tariff threats as a reason for reshaping the supply chain away from Asia.
- The company's value has surged to $2.9 trillion due to the AI market boom, increasing reliance on Taiwanese chipmakers is seen as risky.
- Huang expresses confidence in the US manufacturing capability amidst competition from China, particularly highlighting Huawei's success.
- Recent $100 billion investment by TSMC aids Nvidia in onshoring manufacturing for its top-tier Blackwell chips, enhancing supply chain resilience.

sources.title: TSMC’s Massive Arizona Chips Project Praised by Taiwan’s President
Nvidia will spend hundreds of billions on US manufacturing, says CEO

title: Shein Faces Challenges as Temu Strengthens Its US Logistics Strategy
summary:
- US de minimis exemption for goods under US$800 may be eliminated, impacting Chinese e-commerce like Shein and Temu.
- Shein's direct shipments from China could face import tariffs, prompting a necessary logistics strategy shift.
- Temu's semi-consignment model helps it avoid disruptions, enhancing compliance and efficiency.
- In 2023, Temu reached over US$18 billion in gross merchandise value (GMV), showing strong growth into 2024 with US$20 billion in the first half.
- Temu's logistics model cuts costs and speeds up shipping, unlike Shein's direct approach.
- The potential removal of the US tax exemption for imports may hurt Shein's competitive pricing.
- Temu's model may protect it from tax changes affecting e-commerce imports.
- Shein is considering nearshore production to adapt to new challenges in its market.

sources.title: Temu’s logistics power play puts Shein on the defensive in the US
Shein’s US playbook needs a new look

title: Huawei’s HarmonyOS to power new computer launching in May
summary:

title: The Rise of the AI Manager
summary:
- AI is reshaping the role of knowledge workers, enabling them to become managers of AI agents rather than just individual contributors.
- AI systems are capable of data analysis, report generation, and decision-making, demonstrating their potential as team members.
- Effective management of AI requires both technical skills and soft skills, merging tactical oversight with an understanding of human collaboration.
- Concerns about mass unemployment due to AI are contrasted with the idea that increased efficiency may create new opportunities, similar to trends observed during the industrial revolution.
- Preparing for an AI-centric economy emphasizes the need for enhanced education, AI literacy in the workforce, and self-driven learning for individuals vulnerable to job disruption.

title: Crypto Investments and Major Hacks: Bybit’s $1.4 Billion Heist and MGX's $2 Billion Binance Investment

- The hack is suspected to be linked to North Korea's Lazarus group.
- A breach in a developer's device at SafeWallet led to the hack.
- The FBI confirmed North Korean involvement in the Bybit hack, identifying a group named TraderTraitor.
- Bybit reported theft of 401,346 Ethereum on February 21.
- The FBI issued a warning about potential laundering of stolen assets into fiat.
- North Korea is suspected of orchestrating a $1.5 billion heist from Bybit.
- David Sacks divested over $200 million in digital assets before advising Trump on AI and cryptocurrencies.
- Private crypto venture deals fell to 116 in February 2025, a 60% drop from over 300 in October 2024.
- March investment surged to US$2.3 billion, including a US$2 billion investment in Binance by Abu Dhabi’s MGX, marking Binance’s first institutional investment.

title: Tesla Sales Surge in the UK Amid Global Challenges and Upcoming Protests
summary:
- Tesla sales in the UK rose by 20.7% year on year in February, selling almost 4,000 cars.
- Model 3 and Model Y were the second and third most popular cars sold in the UK.
- Tesla's UK market share increased from 3.75% to 4.6%, despite a 1% overall market decline.
- Demand for electric vehicles surged nearly 42% year on year in the UK.
- Concerns about potential backlash against Tesla exist due to Elon Musk's political influences.
- January saw a nearly 50% drop in Tesla car registrations in Europe, dropping market share to 1%.
- In China, early February data reflects a 49% decline in Tesla exports and retail sales.
- US sales preliminary data for February show a rebound with approximately 42,000 cars sold, up 14% year on year.
- Tesla registrations in Germany fell 76% last month amid rising electric vehicle registrations overall.
- Musk's support for Germany's Alternative für Deutschland has tarnished Tesla’s brand image.
- Activists have staged protests against Musk and Tesla, signaling growing public dissatisfaction.
- Tesla reported a sales decline globally in January 2025, indicating a need for enhanced customer retention.
- Tesla’s stock dropped 15%, marking its worst performance in five years, with global sales experiencing a dramatic decline.
- Owners are selling their Teslas at losses due to dissatisfaction with Musk’s leadership.
- Public sentiment towards Tesla has reached an all-time low, with a notable decline among liberal demographics considering purchase.
- Protests against Tesla are scheduled for March 29th, aiming for 500 demonstrations worldwide.
- The movement started in early February and has expanded to hundreds of locations.
- Protesters oppose CEO Elon Musk's actions related to federal aid program dismantling and service cutbacks.
- An increase in vandalism and violence, unrelated to protests, has led to tensions with officials labeling them as 'domestic terrorism'.
- Tesla’s stock has declined nearly 40% this year, spurring protests as activists aim to diminish its market value.
- Organizers emphasize peaceful demonstrations while preparing for possible legal confrontations.

sources.title: Tesla’s UK sales rise despite threat of backlash over Musk’s political role

title: UK Cybersecurity Agency Issues Quantum Hacker Warning and Apple's Encryption Challenge

- Human rights groups support Apple's challenge, citing concerns about personal data backdoor access.
- Legal experts state government requests must align with human rights protections.
- UK’s cybersecurity agency warns organizations of risks posed by quantum hackers by 2035.
- NCSC recommends implementing post-quantum cryptography for critical infrastructures by 2028.
- Organizations advised to fully migrate to new systems by 2035 to protect against quantum threats.

title: Rising Threat of Stalkerware: Data Breaches and Privacy Issues Uncovered
summary:
- Consumer-grade spyware apps can monitor private messages, photos, calls, and location on Android devices.
- A guide aids in identifying and removing stalkerware like [TheTruthSpy](https://techcrunch.com/2022/10/26/inside-thetruthspy-stalkerware/), [Cocospy](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/20/stalkerware-apps-cocospy-spyic-exposing-phone-data-of-millions-of-people/), and [Spyic](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/20/stalkerware-apps-cocospy-spyic-exposing-phone-data-of-millions-of-people/).
- Stalkerware masquerades as child monitoring software, often installed without consent.
- Symptoms of infection can include odd phone behavior, excessive data consumption, and performance degradation.
- Users should enable [Google Play Protect](https://techcrunch.com/2023/11/04/google-play-android-real-time-app-scanning-sideload-apps/), check accessibility services, and audit notification access.
- The stalkerware industry thrives, marketing apps to jealous partners, with at least 24 companies suffering data breaches since 2017.
- Recent hacks have leaked over 3.2 million email addresses and sensitive data from companies like Spyzie and Cocospy.
- Security expert Eva Galperin calls the stalkerware industry a 'soft target' for hackers.
- Usage of stalkerware is illegal in many jurisdictions and poses risks to victims’ data security.
- Zapier suffered a data breach impacting user privacy; specific details on affected users remain undisclosed.
- NTT Communications confirmed unauthorized data access affecting nearly 18,000 corporate customers, with stolen data including names and contact details.
- Amazon is under scrutiny for not acting on breach notifications and continues to host data from apps like Cocospy and Spyic.
- The apps have exposed data from 3.1 million individuals; Amazon claims to follow compliance but has not acted on alerts.
- A data breach at consumer-grade spyware SpyX affected nearly 2 million people, including many Apple users.
- The breach occurred in June 2024 but was reported only recently, with no communication to affected customers.
- The leaked data included 1.97 million records, most associated with SpyX and its clones MSafely and SpyPhone.
- About 40% of the email addresses were already listed in Have I Been Pwned.
- The breach featured plaintext Apple Account usernames and passwords, raising security concerns for Apple users.
- Google removed a Chrome extension linked to SpyX to uphold store policies against unauthorized surveillance apps.
- Stalkerware apps are designed for spying on partners, with over 25 known hacked companies since 2017.
- The SpyX breach compromised the data of nearly 2 million victims, following previous breaches like Cocospy and mSpy.
- Stalkerware companies often market their products for illegal surveillance, creating significant risks for victims' personal data.

sources.title: Your Android phone could have stalkerware. Here’s how to remove it

Automation platform Zapier breach may expose customer data

title: Europe Pushes for Better Non-Apple Smartwatch Compatibility with iPhones
summary:
- The EU has sent Apple preliminary instructions to comply with interoperability provisions in the Digital Markets Act (DMA).
- Apple must enable access to nine iOS connectivity features for third-party devices, improving compatibility.
- Apple argues the DMA's regulations could threaten user privacy and restrict innovation, calling them anti-competitive.
- The European Commission is instructing Apple to enhance iOS compatibility with third-party devices, including smartwatches and headphones.
- Two legally binding decisions were adopted under the Digital Markets Act (DMA) to allow greater access for app developers and device manufacturers to key iPhone features.
- Apple must provide technical documentation to help developers improve interoperability with iPhones and ensure a predictable review timeline for requests.
- The decisions represent the first concrete measures outlined for compliance with the DMA, according to Teresa Ribera, the EU's vice president for clean and competitive transition.
- Apple has the option to challenge these decisions in a judicial review.

title: Google Faces EU Antitrust Charges for Search and Play Store Practices
summary:
- Google is accused of violating EU antitrust laws by favoring its own services over competitors in search results.

- Google faces potential fines of up to $35 billion if found guilty of DMA violations.
- Changes in Google Search could result in higher ticket prices for consumers and traffic declines for some businesses.
- The EU's investigation into Google Search started on March 25, 2024, following previous fines in 2017.
- Alphabet was designated as a 'gatekeeper' under the DMA in September 2023.
- The compliance deadline for the DMA is set for March 6, 2024.
- Violations of the DMA could lead to fines of up to 10% of Google's global annual turnover.
- Google claims compliance changes may harm consumers and hinder innovation, potentially leading to safety risks.

title: Boston Dynamics Atlas Robot Evolution and Nvidia's Open Foundation Model Announcement

- Developers can customize the model using training data from human tasks.
- The model translates visual input into motor actions with a Diffusion Transformer at 120 Hz.
- It shows a 30% improvement in manipulation tasks.
- Demonstrated cross-embodiment capabilities with LeRobot SO100 robot arm.
- The initiative includes over 300,000 open-sourced simulated trajectories.

- The robot now boasts enhanced sensors for better manipulation of objects.
- Boston Dynamics revealed the new Atlas as part of their commitment to create robots that can handle complex tasks without human intervention.

title: Threat posed by new VMware hyperjacking vulnerabilities is hard to overstate
summary:

title: Go Module Mirror served backdoor to devs for 3+ years

- The issue arose from typosquatting, where users could inadvertently download the backdoored package due to minor name variations.
- Researchers petitioned for its removal after spotting the malicious code, which was cached despite a revert to the legitimate version on GitHub.

title: Google Acquires Wiz for $33 Billion to Strengthen Cloud Security
summary:
- Google is acquiring cloud security startup Wiz for $33 billion, the largest acquisition in its history.
- The deal is pending regulatory approval and has not been officially confirmed by either company.
- Acquisition aims to strengthen Google's position in the enterprise cloud and security market, currently lagging behind AWS and Microsoft Azure.
- Wiz's projected annual recurring revenue (ARR) for this year is $1 billion, up from $500 million last year.
- If finalized, this acquisition will exceed Google's $12.5 billion purchase of Motorola Mobility in 2012.
- Wiz's products will remain available on competing platforms due to antitrust concerns.
- Google Cloud's market share is 12%, compared to AWS's 30% and Azure's 21%, hence a multicloud strategy is essential.
- SoftBank's investment in Wiz in August 2024 has resulted in tripling its initial investment value after the acquisition.
- Wiz, founded in 2020, services nearly 45% of Fortune 100 companies and raised $1 billion at a valuation exceeding $12 billion in May 2024.
- The company expects to achieve a $1 billion revenue rate by 2025.
- This acquisition is noted as the largest tech deal in Israel's history, reflecting a heightened interest in cybersecurity.
- Google’s growth in security services and the acquisition of Wiz may enhance its appeal to potential customers in the rapidly evolving AI and cloud landscape.

sources.title: Google is buying Wiz for $33B to beef up in cloud security, sources say

title: Academics Raise Concerns Over AI Startups and Peer Review Practices
summary:
- Japanese startup Sakana claimed its AI-generated paper is the first to pass peer review, but with caveats.
- Sakana used AI called The AI Scientist-v2 to generate and submit three papers to an ICLR workshop, with one accepted before withdrawal for transparency.
- Critics note the acceptance rate is higher for workshops; many believe AI isn't ready to independently contribute to science yet.
- Controversy surrounds AI-generated studies submitted to the ICLR conference, raising ethical questions about peer review.
- Three AI labs (Sakana, Intology, Autoscience) generated studies; Sakana informed ICLR, while Intology and Autoscience did not.
- Academics express concern over the misuse of peer review, arguing it undermines the volunteer efforts of human reviewers.

title: Overview of Tech Layoffs in 2024 and 2025
summary:
- Over 150,000 job cuts in 2024 across 542 tech companies.

- Layoff trends expected to persist into 2025, as tracked by [Layoffs.fyi](https://layoffs.fyi/).
- A shift towards AI and automation is impacting large companies and startups alike.
- Monthly layoffs tracked from January 2024 to early 2025, with 6,003 jobs cut in January 2025 and 2,268 in December 2024.
- In 2025, over 22,000 tech workers laid off, including 16,084 in February alone.
- Significant layoffs also reported by NASA, Wayfair, and TikTok affecting hundreds of employees.
- Siemens to cut approximately 5,600 jobs globally, focused on automation and electric vehicles.
- HelloFresh plans to lay off 273 jobs in Texas as part of site consolidation.
- Additional notable layoffs include 340 at Wayfair and 2,500 at HPE due to financial adjustments.

title: Samsung Faces AI Chip Challenges Amid Innovation Surge in Computing Companies
summary:
- Companies supporting AI infrastructure see a surge in innovation and revenue.
- Notable mentions:
 - **IBM**: Expanded quantum computing ecosystem, debuted efficient quantum systems, and gained 600,000 registrations for quantum usage.
 - **Lambda Labs**: Launched 1-Click service for instant GPU clusters for AI training, used by major companies and raised $320 million in funding.
 - **TSMC**: Launched state-of-the-art 3 nm processing technology with improvements for AI chips, achieving record revenue in 2024.
 - **SambaNova Systems**: Introduced SambaNova Cloud, focused on AI inference, adding several high-profile clients.
 - **Aligned Data Centers**: Rolled out innovative cooling technology and has extensive data center development plans.
 - **SiMa.ai**: Developed multi-modal AI chips for edge applications, focusing on energy efficiency.
 - **Oxide Computer**: Started selling plug-and-play cloud computers for secure local data processing, with notable government clients.
 - **NextSilicon**: Launched Maverick-2 chip for high-performance computing, focusing on dynamic hardware reconfiguration based on needs.
- Samsung Electronics is facing concerns about its ability to capitalize on the AI boom ahead of its annual general meeting on Mar. 18, 2025.
- The company is experiencing a decline in its competitive edge, particularly in semiconductors, trailing behind SK Hynix in high bandwidth memory chips needed for AI graphics processing.
- Internal communications indicate a focus on maintaining the status quo rather than driving innovation, raising worries about corporate stagnation.
- Recent developments include increasing R&D spending to a record high of $61 billion in 2024, amid tough competition from TSMC exploring a partnership with Intel.
- Several recent articles detail significant changes and events concerning Samsung's operations, including wage increases and recruitment efforts across its subsidiaries.

summary:
- Prosecutors charged director Carl Erik Rinsch with wire fraud and money laundering related to a Netflix series.
- Netflix paid $44 million for Rinsch's unfinished show originally titled *White Horse*, later renamed *Conquest*.
- Rinsch allegedly requested an additional $11 million, which he misappropriated for personal use after Netflix provided it in 2020.
- Prosecutors claim he lost over half of part of the funds in a brokerage account and spent $10 million on personal luxuries, including luxury cars and legal fees.
- The show remains incomplete, and Rinsch's erratic behavior led to Netflix terminating the development in 2021.

title: Trump Fires Democratic FTC Commissioners, Claims of Illegal Dismissal Arise
summary:
- President Trump fired the two remaining Democratic commissioners at the FTC, leading to claims of illegal dismissal.
- Commissioner Alvaro Bedoya called the firing an act of corruption, while Rebecca Kelly Slaughter emphasized its violation of legal precedents.
- The firings are viewed as an attempt to minimize regulatory scrutiny over corporations by a Republican-majority FTC.
- Bedoya plans to testify before Colorado's Joint House and Senate Judiciary Committees and pursue legal action against his dismissal.
- This action challenges a 1935 Supreme Court precedent that protects FTC commissioners from being fired without "good cause."
- Slaughter described the firings as "illegal," claiming they violate statutory language and Court precedent.
- The FTC is responsible for enforcing consumer protection and antitrust laws, and typically has five members.

sources.title: Democratic FTC commissioners say they were just ‘illegally fired’ by President Trump

title: NASA astronauts return from long Space Station stay prompted by Boeing problems
summary:
- Sunita Williams and Barry Wilmore returned to Earth after a nine-month stay on the ISS due to Boeing Starliner's issues.
- They splashed down in the Gulf of Mexico in a SpaceX Dragon capsule after a 17-hour return journey.
- The mission duration was extended because of leaks and thruster problems with the Starliner spacecraft.
- Initially launched in June 2024, the mission was meant to help Boeing compete with SpaceX's historic crewed flights.
- NASA and SpaceX coordinated to bring the astronauts back early in 2025 to avoid short-staffing the ISS.
- Elon Musk claimed he offered to bring them home sooner, a statement disputed by former NASA officials and White House sources.

title: Apple reveals Passwords app vulnerability exposed to phishing attacks for three months.

- Discovered by Mysk in September 2024, Apple confirmed the bug's existence in their security updates on March 17, 2025.

title: Nvidia announces DGX desktop “personal AI supercomputers”
summary:
- Nvidia unveiled two personal AI supercomputers: DGX Spark and DGX Station, powered by the Grace Blackwell platform.
- The systems are designed for running neural networks and target developers, researchers, and data scientists.
- DGX Spark features up to 1,000 trillion operations per second; DGX Station includes 784GB of memory and high network speeds.
- Major manufacturers like Asus, Dell, HP, and Lenovo will produce these systems, with DGX Spark reservations opening now and DGX Station expected later in 2025.

title: Nvidia Unveils New AI Chips: Blackwell Ultra and Rubin Series
summary:
- Nvidia announces two new AI chips: Blackwell Ultra GB300 and Vera Rubin.
- Blackwell Ultra GB300 expected to ship in the second half of 2025; Vera Rubin and Rubin Ultra set for 2026 and 2027 respectively.
- Blackwell Ultra features 20 petaflops of AI performance with 288GB of HBM3e memory.
- A Blackwell Ultra DGX GB300 cluster includes 288 CPUs, 576 GPUs, and 11.5 exaflops of FP4 computing.
- Vera Rubin aims for 50 petaflops of FP4 performance; total system performance can reach 3.6 exaflops in a full rack.
- Rubin Ultra will offer 100 petaflops of FP4 precision and 15 exaflops of inference compute, expected in late 2027.
- Each Rubin Ultra GPU will feature 1TB of HBM4e memory in a system with 365TB total memory.
- Nvidia's founder anticipates a surge in computing power demand, predicting a need for "100 times more than last year."

- Significant increase in child sexual abuse material online is attributed to AI's ability to create difficult-to-analyze imagery.
- AI technologies enable new forms of fraud, extortion, and identity theft through realistic synthetic media and voice cloning.

title: Google Acquires Wiz for $32 Billion; Armis Purchases Otorio for $120 Million
summary:
- Armis acquires Otorio for $120 million in cash and shares, enhancing cybersecurity in industrial and physical environments.
- Otorio’s flagship product, Titan, will integrate into Armis’ Centrix platform.
- This acquisition marks Armis’ third purchase in a year, following Silk Security and CTCI acquisitions.
- The move is part of a trend where early-stage cyber startups opt for acquisitions as funding becomes concentrated in late-stage companies.
- Otorio specializes in operational technology security, complementing Armis' portfolio.
- Google announced its plan to acquire Wiz for $32 billion, marking the largest acquisition in its history and the biggest exit in Israeli history.
- Wiz, founded in January 2020, rapidly grew into a unicorn and significantly increased its valuation over the years, reaching $12 billion by May 2023.
- The company gained attention for identifying vulnerabilities across major cloud platforms, including Microsoft Azure, and raised concerns about sensitive AI data exposure.
- Initially, Google offered $23 billion for Wiz but was rejected, leading Wiz to consider an IPO due to regulatory concerns about Big Tech acquisitions.

title: Nvidia announces new GPUs at GTC 2025, including Vera Rubin + How to watch Nvidia GTC 2025.

- The Rubin can achieve up to 50 petaflops for inference, outperforming existing Blackwell chips.

title: 22-year-old math wiz indicted for alleged DeFI hack that stole $65M
summary:
- A man named Andean Medjedovic was indicted for allegedly stealing $65 million in cryptocurrency through two DeFI hacks.
- The incidents occurred in 2021 and 2023, involving KyberSwap and Indexed Finance platforms.
- Medjedovic exploited smart contract vulnerabilities and used manipulative trading practices to maximize his theft, stealing approximately $48.8 million from 77 liquidity pools.
- He attempted to extort developers and return part of the stolen funds in exchange for control of the KyberSwap protocol.
- Efforts to launder the proceeds included using cryptocurrency mixers and bridge protocols, but a mishap led to his arrest.

- Google’s AI Overviews criticized for inaccuracies, including the infamous glue recommendation.
- Perplexity aims to be a strong alternative to Google AI but also faces content plagiarism claims.
- Gemini 2.0 Flash enables true multimodal image outputs, maintaining character and setting continuity.
- Benchmarking shows Gemini 2.0 Flash excels in text integration within images compared to other models.
- The technology is still developing, with potential improvements in visual knowledge and output quality.

title: Nvidia's Future Plans and RTX 50-Series GPU Launch Insights
summary:
- Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti is a cost-effective alternative to the RTX 4080.
- Launch concerns for RTX 5090 and 5080 raised due to potential rushing.

summary:

title: Bumble is getting ID verification
summary:
- Bumble is rolling out optional ID verification, providing badges for users who confirm their identity with government-issued ID.
- The ID verification requires a passport or driver’s license, along with a selfie, and is currently available in 11 markets, including the US and UK.
- A new feature called Share Date allows users to share date plans with trusted contacts and update them through the app.
- Bumble will now alert users when sending messages that may violate community guidelines, assisting in promoting safer communication.
- These new features reflect similar capabilities offered by Tinder, which launched ID verification in Japan in 2019 and fully implemented it last year.

title: The 10 most innovative security companies of 2025
summary:
- Fast Company highlights innovative security companies for 2025, including Abnormal Security, Nozomi Networks, Huntress, and Shift5.
- Cybercriminals netted over $9 trillion in 2024, making cybercrime a massive economy.
- Huntress protects over 150,000 customers with automation and monitoring, achieving $100 million in annual recurring revenue.
- Shift5 secures critical vehicles from cyber threats and anomalies, doubling revenue and customer base.
- Nozomi Networks introduced Arc Embedded to secure industrial control systems.
- Axiado offers hardware-based AI-driven solutions to enhance data center security and efficiency, raising significant funding.
- Abnormal Security leverages AI to detect fraud in communication apps, expanding rapidly with major financing and growth.

title: The Most Innovative Companies in Space for 2025
summary:
- The list reflects global efforts in diversifying and securing launch and orbital services, essential for national security.
- SpaceX successfully launched its Starship and achieved a midair catch landing of its Super Heavy booster stage.
- Rocket Lab sent 12 Electron rockets into space, becoming the number three launch provider globally, and secured significant contracts.
- Arianespace successfully test-launched its Ariane 6 heavy-lift rocket as a step towards independent European space access.
- Iceye expanded its SAR microsatellite constellation, providing high-resolution coverage for various clients, including the U.S. Department of Defense and Ukraine.
- Innovations included a next-generation satellite bus deployment by Apex and weather-monitoring satellites from Muon Space.
- Intuitive Machines became the first private company to land on the Moon in February 2024.
- Questek developed superalloys for SpaceX’s Super Heavy boosters, and Stardog advanced AI for NASA programs.
- Skylo provided satellite connectivity services for major cellular providers to enable emergency communication.

sources.title: The Most Innovative Companies in Space for 2025

title: How DeepSeek engineered a hyper-efficient rival to ChatGPT
summary:
- DeepSeek ranked No. 12 on the World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies of 2025.
- Released two AI models that significantly reduce the computing power and capital requirements compared to Western models.
- Innovated mixture-of-experts architecture to enhance efficiency in model training and content generation.
- Developed a smaller model, DeepSeek-R1, utilizing reinforcement learning from its larger model, DeepSeek-V3.
- Shared research methods and open-sourced models, promoting transparency in cutting-edge AI.

title: Innovations in Robotics and Engineering for 2025: Focus on Humanoid Robots
summary:
- The first depiction of a machine with a human brain was in [Metropolis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolis_(film)) (1927).
- Humanoid robots are increasingly designed for human-like functions, aided by human-centric data training.
- These robots address labor shortages in aging populations.
- Nvidia's Jensen Huang emphasizes the significance of humanoids in AI advancements.
- Malaysia's first humanoid robot prototype faces challenges, discussed by Hanafiah Yussof.
- Interest in humanoid robots surged after Elon Musk's Optimus prototype reveal in 2022.
- UBTech Robotics launched the Tien Kung Xingzhe robot for research at around US$41,200.
- The robot, standing 1.7 meters tall, features advanced technologies like lidars and Nvidia’s Jetson Orin.
- It can walk at 10 km/h and navigate diverse terrains, with pre-orders expected to deliver in Q2 2025.
- Nearly 70 humanoid robots have been introduced since Tesla's Optimus launch, involving over 51 companies.
- The demand for humanoid robots is driven by labor shortages and advances in generative AI.
- Tesla aims to produce its first batch of humanoid robots this year.
- The article also discusses potential risks with humanoid robots, AI characters, and Microsoft’s Majorana 1 chip.
- Risks include unauthorized actions by humanoid robots and issues of AI character authenticity affecting youth.
- Microsoft’s Majorana 1 chip highlights the necessity for quantum-resistant algorithms for data security.
- The global robotics market is expected to exceed $100 billion by 2025, a significant rise from $17 billion a decade ago.
- Key indoor robot producers include FANUC and Apptronik; Percepto and CNH focus on outdoor applications.
- Simbe Robotics has raised $50 million for its Tally robots, enhancing retail inventory management.
- Apptronik, developing humanoid robots like Apollo, collaborates with Nvidia and Google for AI integration.
- Flock Safety uses drones for police work, reducing emergency response times significantly.
- GrayMatter Robotics enhances efficiency with AI to predict malfunctions, improving productivity.
- CNH's agricultural robots utilize AI for precision farming, boosting efficiency and reducing fuel consumption.
- Percepto provides a “drone-in-a-box” solution for automated industrial inspections and environmental hazard monitoring.
- Performance Drone Works manufactures military drones informed by conflict experiences, securing significant U.S. military contracts.

title: The most innovative companies in manufacturing for 2025 + Foxconn unveils first AI model for manufacturing, supply chain
summary:
- Foxconn introduced 'FoxBrain', its first large language model for manufacturing and supply chain management.
- Trained on 120 Nvidia H100 GPUs for four weeks, based on Meta's Llama 3.1 architecture.
- Optimized for traditional Chinese and Taiwanese, capable of data analysis, decision support, document collaboration, problem-solving, and code generation.
- Initially for internal use; plans to collaborate with partners and share open-source elements.
- Training utilized Nvidia’s Taipei-1 supercomputer in Kaohsiung.
- More information to be revealed at Nvidia’s GTC developer conference later this month.
- Advances in manufacturing are often incremental rather than breakthroughs.
- Blackline Safety improves gas detection with real-time monitoring devices.
- Kraft Heinz enhances its supply chain using machine vision and digital twin modeling.
- Stratasys excels in additive manufacturing, introducing fast 3D printers for complex aerospace components.
- Gelato and Keychain build online marketplaces for on-demand printing and packaged goods.
- Dirtt Environmental Solutions customizes modular construction for commercial facilities.
- P2 Science launches sustainable cosmetic ingredients derived from upcycled materials.
- Keychain leverages AI to connect CPG brands with qualified manufacturers quickly.
- Blackline Safety's new monitor enables real-time hazardous gas detection, enhancing worker safety.
- HT Materials Science develops an additive to improve HVAC system efficiency.

title: How these 10 gaming companies are keeping players engaged in inventive ways
summary:

- **EA Sports** launched *College Football 25*, becoming the top-selling sports game in the U.S., integrating real college athletes into the game.
- **Bandai Namco** released *Tekken 8*, featuring an advanced tutorial mode that adapts to players' styles.
- **LocalThunk**'s *Balatro* became a viral success with over 2 million sales due to its unique poker-style gameplay.
- **Game Science**’s *Black Myth: Wukong* achieved massive sales, elevating China's game development on the global stage.
- **Our Odyssey** introduced *Overjoyed*, a tool for gamers with disabilities to enhance accessibility.

title: Why these 10 medical device makers are the most innovative in the world
summary:
- The medical devices industry is experiencing an unprecedented technology boom fueled by AI.
- HistoSonics offers the Edison histotripsy system, received FDA clearance in October 2023, with a 95.5% effectiveness rate in treating liver tumors.
- Heartflow uses an AI platform for comprehensive heart diagnostics, achieving 95% accuracy; utilized in 84% of top heart hospitals in the U.S.
- ROMTech has developed the PortableConnect for telemedicine rehabilitation, helping over 98,000 patients and saving costs compared to traditional therapy.
- Xenco Medical’s TrabeculeX Continuum aids in spinal surgery recovery, launched in January 2024, has been adopted in 52 hospitals.
- SprintRay enables rapid in-office dental prosthetics creation, sold over 7,000 devices in 2024, impacting nearly 600,000 patients.
- Cala Health’s Cala kIQ addresses essential tremors, 89% efficacy noted in a study with Medicare coverage across all states as of 2024.
- Medtronic received FDA clearance for its PulseSelect system for treating atrial fibrillation, benefiting 20,000 patients.
- Virtual Incision's MIRA robotic system for minimally invasive surgery received FDA approval, and was tested in space.
- The article recognizes the ongoing innovation in the medical device sector, highlighting significant advancements and their implications for patient care.

- Waymo cannot use autonomous vehicles for commercial goods movement, focusing on job safety and community impact.

title: 10 Innovative Biotech Companies Transforming Drug Discovery and Treatment
summary:

- Funding led by Value Partners Group with participation from Warburg Pincus, OrbiMed Advisors, and Eli Lilly & Co.
- Funds will enhance Insilico’s AI platform and support clinical development of Rentosertib for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, which has completed Phase IIa trials.

- Conducts chemical synthesis in China and advanced trials in the US.
- Secured contracts worth about US$3.5 billion by licensing assets to firms like Fosun Pharma and Exelixis.

- Recursion advancing its AI-driven drug discovery platform and partnered with Roche for neuroscience research.

title: The most innovative companies in applied AI for 2025

- Generative AI models have improved productivity for businesses as employees utilize AI tools like chatbots and coding assistants.
- In 2024, startups such as [Glean](http://glean.com/), [Contextual AI](https://contextual.ai/), and [Blackbird.AI](https://blackbird.ai/) gained traction with innovative AI solutions.

summary:
- Tesla owners are protesting against Elon Musk by disguising their cars with fake badges and joining Facebook support groups.
- Donald Trump humorously stated, "Everything’s computer!" during a Tesla car show at the White House, which sparked a viral meme.
- Tesla's stock has fallen 37% since early 2025 due to recession fears and a potential trade war.
- Increasing protests against Musk's political involvement and rising vandalism against Tesla are notable.

title: BYD Unveils Fast Charging Technology Outpacing Tesla
summary:
- BYD introduces a new EV platform with a 1,000-volt architecture for quicker charging.
- Vehicles can travel 400 kilometers with only a five-minute charge.
- Announcement made at BYD's Shenzhen headquarters, including plans for 4,000 ultra-fast charging stations in China.
- Founder Wang Chuanfu noted a peak charging speed of 1,000 kilowatts.
- The “Super e-Platform” technology adds 400 km (249 miles) of range in just five minutes.
- Charging speeds of 1,000kW are double that of Tesla's future V4 superchargers.
- The technology will first be available in the Han L sedan and Tang L SUV, starting at 270,000 yuan (about $37,330).
- BYD aims to ease charging anxiety by making EV charging times comparable to gasoline refueling.
- In 2024, BYD sold 1.76 million cars, closely competitive with Tesla's 1.79 million sales, primarily in China.

summary:
- Nio received 4 billion yuan (US$552.18 million) from two state-owned firms in Anhui Province.
- Investment details: Hefei Jianxiang invested 2.86 billion yuan for a 3.46% stake; Anhui Gaoxin contributed 1.14 billion yuan for a 1.38% stake.
- Nio's registered capital rises to 8.257 billion yuan, reflecting local government support.
- Post-investment, Nio's shares increased by 2.42%, valuing the company at HK$70.866 billion (US$911.94 million).
- Nio has raised approximately 118.7 billion yuan (US$16.39 billion) in 16 financing rounds.
- Nio partners with CATL to develop a battery-swapping network, aiming for industry standardization.

title: YC-backed food supply startup Vendease restructures employees’ salaries
summary:
- Vendease, a Y Combinator-backed Nigerian food procurement startup, has changed its pay structure to a performance-based system after laying off 44% of its workforce.
- The new compensation model includes a five-phase salary recovery plan, aiming for full salary restoration by December 2025 based on performance targets.
- Vendease is seeking fresh capital and aims to become profitable by leveraging its software-driven operations and a buy now, pay later (BNPL) product to support food businesses.

title: The story of Monolith Productions: a respected game studio's unexpected closure
summary:
- Warner Bros announced the closure of three game studios including Monolith Productions due to a strategic change.
- Monolith Productions was founded in 1994 and was known for its unique and unpredictable game designs.
- Some of its notable games include *Blood*, *The Operative: No One Lives Forever*, and *Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor*.
- The studio was recognized for its innovative gameplay features like the Nemesis system, which was patented by Warner Bros.
- Monolith had not released any new games in the last eight years before its shutdown, prompting concerns about industry practices.

- Nairobi-based Leta uses AI for optimizing delivery routes, tracking shipments, and streamlining payments.
- Leta raised $5 million in seed funding led by Speedinvest, backed by Google’s Africa Investment Fund.

- The funds will be used to expand by opening new dark stores and strengthening the leadership team, aiming to cover 80% of Bengaluru’s pincodes.

title: Performing arts leaders issue copyright warning over UK government’s AI plans
summary:
- Over 30 UK performing arts leaders, including heads from National Theatre and Royal Albert Hall, express concerns over government AI plans.
- They emphasize that artists depend on copyright for their livelihoods and urge government support for creative rights.
- Signatories include executives from Sadler’s Wells, Royal Shakespeare Company, and City of Birmingham Symphony Orchestra.
- The statement criticizes the government's plan to allow AI companies to use copyrighted work without explicit consent from artists.
- Leaders call for transparency obligations on AI companies regarding the copyrighted materials used in training.
- Notable figures in the creative industries have criticized the proposals, including Sir Paul McCartney and Kate Bush.

sources.title: Performing arts leaders issue copyright warning over UK government’s AI plans

- Founded by behavioral scientist Michael Sankey and technologist Sara Khorasani, the platform analyzes customer sentiment via AI and surveys to improve marketing efforts.
- Funds will also support platform refinement, emphasizing human oversight for data reliability.

- Cognition AI Inc. raises funding, increasing valuation to nearly US$4 billion.
- Funding round led by 8VC, with participation from Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, Elad Gil, and Conviction Partners.
- Valuation doubled from US$2 billion last year.

title: Indonesia Stock Exchange temporarily halted trading
summary:
- The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) halted trading on Mar. 18 after a 5.02% decline in the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) to 5,146.
- Suspension took effect at 11:19:31 Jakarta Automated Trading System (JATS) time.
- Trading resumed at 11:49:31 JATS time without changes to the regular schedule.
- The IDX uses trading halts to manage market imbalances and protect investors from extreme price volatility.
- The IHSG had shown weakness earlier, falling by 0.99% on Mar. 17 to 6,450.8.

title: US Commerce agency bans DeepSeek on gov’t devices, sources say
summary:
- The US Department of Commerce bans employees from using DeepSeek on government devices.
- Internal instructions prohibit staff from downloading or using DeepSeek applications or websites on government equipment.
- Lawmakers express data security concerns, with legislation introduced to prevent DeepSeek access due to risks of sensitive information benefiting the Chinese Communist Party.

- The fintech sector experienced significant growth during the pandemic but faced challenges in 2024, including the shutdown of accounting startup Bench.
- Despite a slowdown in funding, many fintech firms are still hiring, with some companies opening even more roles than in previous months.
- Various fintech companies are listed with their available job openings, serving as a resource for those seeking employment in the industry.

title: Google has a fix for all of the broken Chromecasts
summary:
- Google started rolling out an update on Thursday to fix Chromecasts that lost the ability to cast.
- The new update addresses issues with Chromecast devices that were bricked after a factory reset.
- Affected owners received confirmation from Google that everything should function normally now.
- The update includes a new Google Home app version (3.30.1.6 for Android, 3.30.106 for iOS) to revive broken Chromecast devices.
- The exact cause of the issues was not disclosed, but it may be linked to an expired certificate according to user findings.
- The rollout of the new app update began recently and may take a few days to reach all users.

sources.title: Google has a fix for all of the broken Chromecasts

title: The Internet’s Obsession with Luigi Mangione Is Testing Reddit’s Limits
summary:
- Luigi Mangione, accused of murdering UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has become an internet phenomenon since December.
- The subreddit r/popculture was suspended for approving violent comments about Mangione, leading to community outrage.
- Reddit clarified there is no sitewide filter on the name 'Luigi', and suspensions were due to approving comments advocating violence.
- Despite restrictions, other subreddits like r/FreeLuigi remain active and claim to promote updates on Mangione's case without endorsing violence.
- Reddit's safety team warned users against upvoting violent content, with possible future consequences for such actions.

sources.title: The Internet’s Obsession with Luigi Mangione Is Testing Reddit’s Limits

title: Robinhood launches prediction markets hub
summary:
- Robinhood launched a prediction markets hub allowing customers to trade on event outcomes.
- The hub includes predictions like the expected upper limit of the Federal Reserve funds rate in May.
- Robinhood's shares rose 6% in afternoon trading following the launch.
- Event contracts gained popularity since the U.S. presidential election, enabling bets on various outcomes.
- The launch marked Robinhood's entry into a market where it faced both enthusiasm from traders and criticism likening it to gambling.
- In February, Robinhood canceled Super Bowl betting contracts after regulatory pushback from the CFTC.

sources.title: Robinhood launches prediction markets hub

title: A sodium-ion portable power bank comes to market
summary:
- Elecom introduces the first consumer-ready sodium-ion power bank, the Na Plus, with a capacity of 9,000mAh.
- The Na Plus is claimed to last up to 5,000 charges and can operate in extreme temperatures from -30 to 122°F.
- Priced at 9,980 yen (around $67), it is debuting in Japan with no current plans for wider rollout.
- The power bank features 45W output through USB-C and 18W through USB-A, taking about two hours to fully charge.
- Sodium-ion technology is seen as more environmentally friendly and safer than lithium-ion, though it is bulkier and heavier due to lower energy density.

sources.title: A sodium-ion portable power bank comes to market

title: Flexport accuses former employees of stealing its source code to create a rival startup
summary:
- Flexport is suing former employees Yingwei Zhao and Bryan Lacaillade for allegedly stealing its source code and documents to form their startup Freightmate AI.
- Zhao is accused of downloading over 70,000 confidential Flexport documents and copying customer lists using Incognito Mode.
- Freightmate admitted to having some files but claimed they were retained inadvertently and not used.
- Flexport seeks unspecified damages and an injunction against the use of the allegedly stolen data.

title: Great savings on the EcoFlow Delta Pro 3, which will keep your home powered
summary:
- EcoFlow is offering discounts on its portable batteries and power stations through March 26th.
- The Delta Pro 3 power station is currently priced at $2,899, a $700 reduction from its usual price of $3,699.
- The Delta Pro 3 can power 120V and 240V appliances, charge via solar or AC, and multiple units can be linked for more power.
- EcoFlow's River 3 Portable Power Station is also on sale for $189, ideal for camping and outdoor use.

title: Trump's Claims on Biden's Pardons and the Autopen Controversy
summary:
- Trump asserts that some of Biden's pardons are void because they were allegedly signed using an autopen.
- He claims that Biden was unaware of the pardons, citing a post on Truth Social.
- Critics point out that Trump's claims lack evidence, and Biden has publicly addressed the pardons.
- Autopen usage by presidents has historical precedent, with past presidents like Ford and Obama using them for signing documents.
- The Justice Department has previously indicated there is no legally prescribed method for executive clemency signature.
- Donald Trump claimed that Joe Biden's pardons are void because they were signed by an autopen.
- Autopens have been used by several presidents, starting with Harry Truman.
- Trump raised concerns about the legitimacy of Biden's pardons, stating they were done without Biden's knowledge.
- The autopen is a device that duplicates signatures using a robotic arm and pen, differing from digital signatures.

title: The entire story of Twitter / X under Elon Musk + X is having an up and down Monday
summary:
- X faced global outages affecting mobile and desktop since approximately 5:40 AM ET, with users experiencing issues like timeline refresh failures and error messages.
- New users in two countries will be charged $1 per year.
- Reports indicate lower than expected ad revenue sharing for users.
- Elon Musk is attempting to rehabilitate his image with X after prior setbacks.
- The iconic ‘X’ sign from the former Twitter headquarters has been removed.
- Instagram's Threads app is seen as a competitor challenging X.
- X's ad revenue sharing model is under criticism due to performance issues.
- A cyberattack was claimed by Musk during a major outage impacting many users.
- An auction is taking place for the previous Twitter logo as part of the rebranding initiative.

title: OpenAI to start testing ChatGPT connectors for Google Drive and Slack
summary:
- OpenAI is beta testing a feature called ChatGPT Connectors for business customers.
- The feature will enable integration with Google Drive and Slack for enhanced responses based on internal data.
- Future expansions to include platforms like Microsoft SharePoint and Box are planned.
- ChatGPT Connectors aims to facilitate use of internal knowledge similarly to web search.
- Concerns exist about ChatGPT accessing sensitive information; some businesses are cautious, while others are supportive.
- The connectors will sync encrypted copies of company files with ChatGPT, while maintaining strict adherence to user access permissions.
- Limitations include inability to analyze certain data types and restrictions on accessing private Slack messages.
- Companies interested in beta testing must provide 100 documents which will not be used for training but may help in synthetic data creation.

sources.title: OpenAI to start testing ChatGPT connectors for Google Drive and Slack

title: Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, acquires a generative AI video startup
summary:
- Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, has acquired Hotshot, a startup focusing on AI-powered video generation tools.
- Hotshot's CEO, Aakash Sastry, announced the acquisition via a post on X.
- The startup had developed three video foundation models over the past 2 years: Hotshot-XL, Hotshot Act One, and Hotshot.
- Hotshot was initially centered on AI-powered photo tools before pivoting to text-to-video models.
- The acquisition might lead to xAI developing competitive video generation models against Sora and Google’s Veo 2.
- Hotshot had previously received investments from notable VCs but undisclosed its funding rounds.
- Customers have until March 30 to download videos created using Hotshot, which began sunsetting new video creation on March 14.

sources.title: Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, acquires a generative AI video startup

title: YC-backed ReactWise is applying AI to speed up drug manufacturing
summary:
- ReactWise, a YC-backed startup, is using AI to enhance chemical manufacturing, aiming to expedite drug production processes by 30 times.
- The firm plans to automate predictions for ideal experimental setups, potentially achieving this in two years.
- Founded in July 2024, ReactWise has secured $3.4 million in pre-seed funding and currently has 12 pilot trials with pharmaceutical companies, including some large players in the industry.

title: Klarna nabs Walmart away from Affirm and boosts its IPO prospects
summary:
- Klarna has announced a partnership to provide buy now, pay later loans for Walmart, taking over from Affirm.
- Klarna will implement the loan service through OnePay towards the end of this year.
- Affirm's stock fell 8% following the news, while Klarna's IPO filing indicates its recovery after a prior valuation drop.

title: Telegram founder, Pavel Durov, allowed to leave France — despite ongoing criminal investigation
summary:
- Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram, allowed to leave France after modifying supervision conditions.
- Durov was arrested on August 24, 2024, over allegations of facilitating organized fraud and CSAM sharing.
- He initially had to pay €5 million bail and was barred from leaving France. These conditions have now changed.
- Investigation remains ongoing, and Durov still faces potential criminal trial in France.
- Telegram updated its policies post-arrest to enhance moderation and reporting of private chats.

title: Texas man faces prison for activating ‘kill switch’ on former employer’s network
summary:
- Texas software developer Davis Lu faces up to 10 years in prison after being convicted of damaging his former employer’s network.
- Lu began sabotaging the systems after a corporate restructuring in 2018 reduced his responsibilities.
- He created a 'kill switch' that locked all employees out of the network when his credentials were deactivated, which activated upon his departure on September 9, 2019.
- The disruption affected thousands of employees and caused significant financial losses to the company.
- Sentencing is scheduled for June 23.

sources.title: Texas man faces prison for activating ‘kill switch’ on former employer’s network

title: Xiaomi 15 Ultra and Nothing Phone 3A Announced, Pixel 9A Leaks Ahead of Launch
summary:
- Xiaomi announced the 15 Ultra flagship phone in China, starting at 6,499 yuan (~$893).
- Features a 200MP periscope camera optimized for low light, launching internationally on March 2 at Mobile World Congress.
- New periscope lens supports 4.3x zoom, main camera fixed aperture of f/1.63, powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
- Nothing Phone 3A and 3A Pro launched, with prices starting at $379 and $459, featuring Snapdragon 7S Gen 3, 12 GB RAM, and 256 GB storage.
- Both models include a 50MP main camera; the Pro has a 3x telephoto lens.
- New Essential Space feature uses AI to organize media; both phones ship with Android 15 and three years of updates.
- Leaked videos of the Pixel 9A show a 6.3-inch display, a 48MP main camera, and a 5,100mAh battery, expected reveal on March 19.

summary:

- Kala has gained a following of over 657,000 on TikTok by documenting her digging project in Herndon, Virginia, which she began as a hobby in 2022.
- The tunnel currently extends 22 feet below ground and features a 30-foot entrance; future expansion may require additional permits and engineering evaluations.

summary:
- The Trump administration is enforcing stricter regulations on university speech, beginning with Columbia University.
- DHS agents raided Columbia, investigating student protesters for possible violations of federal terrorism laws.
- Columbia faces pressure to discipline student activists or risk losing federal funding.
- Several students, including Grant Miner, were expelled or suspended for their protest involvement.
- Mahmoud Khalil's immigration case illustrates the use of a McCarthy-era statute for deportation.
- Student activists are legally challenging the university's response to government demands.
- Khalil, detained by ICE, faces a precarious legal situation with possible deportation.

title: Snap’s AR Spectacles Introduce GPS and Virtual Keyboard Features
summary:
- Snap has launched new features for its Spectacles AR glasses including GPS and hand-tracking capabilities.
- Developers can now create Lenses using geo-location data and custom locations for enhanced location-based experiences.
- New applications like [NavigatAR](https://techcrunch.com/2025/03/17/snap-expands-spectacles-capabilities-with-gps-and-hand-tracking-features/) from Utopia Labs use Snap Map Tiles to assist users.
- Users can now also track hand gestures and see when they are holding a phone, adding to interaction possibilities.
- A leaderboard feature can be added for competitive Lenses, and a new AR keyboard is introduced.
- Spectacles are available through a $99/month developer program, with a 50% discount for educators and students.
- Snap's Spectacles now feature GPS for navigation and improved hand tracking.
- An AR keyboard allows for text entry without a connected smartphone.
- New AR capabilities include location-based gaming and walking course development for users.
- Spectacles remain developer-only, requiring a $99 monthly rental commitment for at least a year.

- Netflix established its own content delivery network, Open Connect, distributing over 18,000 servers across 175 countries.

summary:
- TikTok introduces a new “Security Checkup” tool for users to review and update their account security settings.
- The tool can be accessed via “Settings and privacy” and “Security and permissions” from the user’s profile.
- It guides users through security features, encouraging them to enable enhanced security options like phone number linking and two-step verification.
- Users are reminded to check active devices and may enable biometric authentication for secure logins.
- TikTok monitors for unusual behavior, notifying users through the app.

title: Max just wiped its classic Looney Tunes lineup
summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery removed the entire lineup of classic Looney Tunes shorts (1930-1969) from its streaming service, Max.
- The company confirmed the focus will shift to adult and family programming rather than kids' content.
- This follows earlier removals of Looney Tunes episodes at the end of 2022 and confusion over the series' availability.
- Newer Looney Tunes content remains available on Max.
- This content purge is part of broader cuts following David Zaslav's takeover of Warner Bros. Discovery.

summary:
- A DOGE staffer, Marko Elez, violated Treasury policy by sending unencrypted personal data to Trump administration officials.
- Elez had previously resigned due to racist social media posts, but was rehired by DOGE.
- 19 state attorneys general are suing the Treasury over DOGE's system access, which has been limited due to Elez's actions.
- The security breach was revealed during an investigation into Elez's laptop and email account.

title: Travis Kalanick wants to do a lot more than develop more ghost kitchens
summary:
- Travis Kalanick shared his vision for CloudKitchens at the [Abundance Summit](http://abundance360.com/summit) in Los Angeles.
- Kalanick aims to evolve CloudKitchens from providing restaurant spaces to delivering AI-optimized meals directly to customers.
- He draws parallels between his business model and past industry disruptors like Uber and Zynga.
- Kalanick expressed concerns about restaurants relying on third-party platforms like Uber Eats and DoorDash.
- He emphasized the concept of cooking-as-a-service and the goal of making healthy meals universally accessible.
- AI's role in the future of food services was highlighted, emphasizing real-world applications beyond just digital interactions.
- Kalanick and fellow entrepreneur Marc Lore are targeting a future where AI enhances meal planning and health monitoring for consumers.
- Both CloudKitchens and Lore's venture Wonder have raised substantial investments, with Wonder acquiring GrubHub last November.

summary:

- National Nurses United organized over 20 demonstrations advocating for nurses' rights in AI usage and protection from automated advice.
- AI can cause false alarms and dangerous advice; nurses emphasize the importance of human judgment in patient care.

summary:

- Smugglers adapt to changing environments and use technology to reach new audiences, moving away from traditional networks.

title: Xbox 360 consoles can now be hacked with just a USB key
summary:
- Xbox 360 modders have a new software exploit called [BadUpdate](https://github.com/grimdoomer/Xbox360BadUpdate) that allows running unsigned code via a USB key.
- The method enables access to the homebrew store, which includes games, apps, emulators, and utilities without opening the console.
- Limitations include needing to manually patch executables and the exploit’s reliability can vary, requiring reactivation on each console boot.

title: SG’s Creative Technology lays off 14% of its employees
summary:
- Creative Technology, based in Singapore, has laid off about 40 employees, which is 14% of its workforce.
- Affected departments included sales and marketing.
- The company currently has over 280 employees, a significant reduction from its numbers in the early 2000s.
- Creative reported a net loss of US$6.1 million for the first half of its fiscal year ending Dec. 31, 2024, up from a loss of US$4.1 million the previous year.
- Despite an 18% increase in net sales to US$37.4 million, financial challenges persist, attributed to market decline.
- The company is in search of a new CEO following Song Siow Hui's retirement in February 2025, after the death of founder Sim Wong Hoo in January 2023.

title: Catcha Digital unit to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion
summary:
- Catcha Digital, through its subsidiary iMedia Asia, plans to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion Studio for 37.32 million ringgit (around US$8.39 million) in cash.
- The acquisition involves purchasing 600,000 shares of Framemotion, a digital media advertising solutions provider.
- Framemotion is expected to achieve a profit after tax of at least 6.8 million ringgit (around US$1.5 million) in the first year post-acquisition.
- A similar profit target is set for the following year as well. 
- The deal aims to leverage Catcha Digital’s digital advertising expertise with Framemotion’s strengths in virtual and augmented reality content.

title: The big idea: do we worry too much about misinformation?
summary:
- On 30 October 1938, a radio broadcast of HG Wells's The War of the Worlds created a panic many believed to be real, though studies show mass panic didn't occur.
- Current perceptions of misinformation may be exaggerated; for example, during Covid, visits to 'trustworthy' news sites grew dramatically, outpacing those deemed 'untrustworthy'.
- It’s important to challenge both false beliefs and the dismissal of true information without over-skepticism, as both extremes could hinder understanding and trust in media.

sources.title: The big idea: do we worry too much about misinformation?

title: Discord launches SDK to help developers enhance social experiences in their games
